c74object.name: udp_qasm
c74object.description: Based on OSC-Qasm, this is a simple UDP-based interface for executing Qasm code. (or a simple bridge to connect The QAC Toolkit with real quantum hardware)

objarg.name: send_port
objarg.description:
The server port that udp_qasm will use to send the qasm code to.
This defaults to 5000.

objarg.name: ip
objarg.description:
The IP address where the server is located.
This defaults to udp-qasm.och.pw.

objarg.name: shots
objarg.description:
The number of shots to use when executing the Qasm code.
This defaults to 1024.

objarg.name: backend
objarg.description:
The backend name.
This can be the Qiskit simulator, "qasm_simulator", or any of the real hardware backends available to the server's IBM Quantum account.
Additionally, this can also be one of the following available fake backends:
FakeAlmaden, FakeArmonk, FakeAthens, FakeBelem, FakeBoeblingen, FakeBogota, FakeBrooklyn, FakeBurlington, FakeCambridge, FakeCambridgeAlternativeBasis, FakeCasablanca, FakeEssex, FakeGuadalupe, FakeJakarta, FakeJohannesburg, FakeLagos, FakeLima, FakeLondon, FakeManhattan, FakeManila, FakeMelbourne, FakeMontreal, FakeMumbai, FakeOurense, FakeParis, FakePoughkeepsie, FakeQuito, FakeRochester, FakeRome, FakeRueschlikon, FakeSantiago, FakeSingapore, FakeSydney, FakeTenerife, FakeTokyo, FakeToronto, FakeValencia, FakeVigo, FakeYorktown.
This defaults to "qasm_simulator".

objarg.name: info
objarg.description:
Enable or disable Info mode by setting this attribute to 1 or 0, respecitvely.
Info mode allows udp_qasm to print to the console some information about the computation, including notification of which backend is being used, confirmation of when the results are being sent back to Max, and (experimental) the place in the queue of the job submitted.
This defaults to 1.

method.name: qasm
method.description: udp_qasm is expecting to receive a list of 2 symbols. The first one "qasm" and the second one containing all the Qasm code.

method.name: pass
method.description: Set the required server-specific password to use.

method.name: backend
method.description:
The symbol "backend" followed by a single symbol, containing the name of a valid backend, will replace the backend to use the next time udp_qasm receives a qasm message. The backend used by default is "qasm_simulator".
This can also be any of the real hardware backends available to the server's IBM Quantum account.
Additionally, this can also be one of the following available fake backends:
FakeAlmaden, FakeArmonk, FakeAthens, FakeBelem, FakeBoeblingen, FakeBogota, FakeBrooklyn, FakeBurlington, FakeCambridge, FakeCambridgeAlternativeBasis, FakeCasablanca, FakeEssex, FakeGuadalupe, FakeJakarta, FakeJohannesburg, FakeLagos, FakeLima, FakeLondon, FakeManhattan, FakeManila, FakeMelbourne, FakeMontreal, FakeMumbai, FakeOurense, FakeParis, FakePoughkeepsie, FakeQuito, FakeRochester, FakeRome, FakeRueschlikon, FakeSantiago, FakeSingapore, FakeSydney, FakeTenerife, FakeTokyo, FakeToronto, FakeValencia, FakeVigo, FakeYorktown.

method.name: shots
method.description: The symbol "shots" followed by a single int number will change the number of shots to use the next time udp_qasm receives a qasm message.

attribute.name: send_port
attribute.description:
The server port that udp_qasm will use to send the qasm code to.
This defaults to 5000.

attribute.name: ip
attribute.description:
The IP address where the server is located.
This defaults to udp-qasm.och.pw.

Info mode allows udp_qasm to print to the console some information about the computation, including notification of which backend is being used, confirmation of when the results are being sent back to Max, and (experimental) the place in the queue of the job submitted.

entry.name: list
entry.description: Outputs a list containing 2 symbols. The first one "counts" and the second one containing all the execution counts in the format "bitstring counts bitstring counts ...".
